graph.components
Class BasicGraph<N extends Node,E extends Edge<? extends N>>

java.lang.Object
  graph.components.BasicGraph<N,E>
Type Parameters:
N - is the type of node to which the graph's edges will connect. they can be of type Node or any of its subclasses
E - is the type of edges contained in the graph. They can be of type Edge or any of its subclasses that connect to nodes of type N or any of its subclasses.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Graph<N,E>
Direct Known Subclasses:
BasicWeightedGraph
public class BasicGraph<N extends Node,E extends Edge<? extends N>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graph<N,E>

This class creates a basic graph that contains nodes and directed edges that connect to two nodes. Loops are permitted, as well as multiple edges connecting to the same nodes. Unconnected nodes are not permitted

Since:
Mar 16, 2014
Author:
Mathieu LŽger

Method Detail

getAllEdges

public java.util.Set<E> getAllEdges()
Description copied from interface: Graph
Returns an unmodifiable Set of all the graph's edges.

NOTE: This set is backed by the graph, which means that changes to the graph's edges will be reflected in this set. Therefore, one must be careful not to make changes to the graph while iterating through this set.

NOTE: The returned Set is unmodifiable and will therefore throw UnsupportedOperationException if one attempts to call its add() or remove() methods.

Specified by:
getAllEdges in interface Graph<N extends Node,E extends Edge<? extends N>>
Returns:
unmodifiable Set of all the edges contained in the graph.

removeEdge

public boolean removeEdge(E edge)
Description copied from interface: Graph
Removes the supplied edge from the graph. Also removes any nodes from the graph that, as a result of the edge removal, are note connected to any edge.

Specified by:
removeEdge in interface Graph<N extends Node,E extends Edge<? extends N>>
Parameters:
edge - to be removed from the graph.
Returns:
boolean indicating if the edge and the resulting unconnected nodes were successfully removed to the graph.

getAllNodes

public java.util.Set<N> getAllNodes()
Description copied from interface: Graph
Returns an unmodifiable Set of all the graph's nodes.

NOTE: This set is backed by the graph, which means that changes to the graph's nodes will be reflected in this set. Therefore, one must be careful not to make changes to the graph while iterating through this set.

NOTE: The returned Set is unmodifiable and will therefore throw UnsupportedOperationException if one attempts to call its add() or remove() methods.

Specified by:
getAllNodes in interface Graph<N extends Node,E extends Edge<? extends N>>
Returns:
unmodifiable Set of all the nodes contained in the graph.

Description copied from interface: Graph
Removes the supplied node from the graph. Also removes all the edges connected to the node.

Parameters:
node - to be removed from the graph.
Returns:
boolean indicating if the node and its associated edges were successfully removed to the graph.

isEmpty

Specified by:
isEmpty in interface Graph<N extends Node,E extends Edge<? extends N>>
